intro: Chaetanthera acerosa, commonly known as the sharp-leaved chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
